BodyPart.Text:
by Tara Newman

  • Prep Time: 10 min
  • Cook Time: 25 min
  • Serves: 4

Recipe

Ingredients

  • 1 ½ lb. Ground Beef
  • 1 ½ cup Fresh Parsley, minced, divided
  • 2 tablespoons Green Onion, minced
  • 1 teaspoon Kosher Salf
  • ½ teaspoon Gound Pepper
  • 3 tablespoons All Purpose Flour, divided
  • 2 tablespoons Canola Oil
  • 2 cups Onions, sliced
  • 3-4 Garlic Cloves minced
  • 3 teaspoons Tomato Paste
  • 2 cups Beef Broth
  • ¼ cup Red Wine
  • 2 teaspoons Dried Thyme
  • 1 baguette sliced 1/2 in. thick
  • 3 tablespoons Butter, softened
  • 1 tablespoon Garlic Powder
  • 1 tablespoon Paprika
  • ¾ cup Parmesan Cheese, shredded or shaved

Directions

  1. Combine the ground beef, all but 3 tablespoons of the parsley, green onion, salt, and pepper. Shape mixture into 4 oval patties.
  2. Place 2 tablespoons of flour into a dish and dredge each patty through the flour.
  3. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
  4. Add the patties and sauté until browned on each side.
  5. Remove patties from the pan to a plate.
  6. Add onions to the pan and sauté 5 minutes.
  7. Stir in the garlic and tomato paste, sauté until paste begins to brown, about 1 min.
  8. Sprinkle the remaining flour over the paste. Cook 1 minute. Stir in broth, wine, and thyme.
  9. Return patties to the pan and bring sauce to a boil.
  10. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover pan and simmer for 10 minutes.
  11. Meanwhile, add bread to a baking sheet. Butter each piece and lightly sprinkle with garlic powder, a pinch of paprika and half the parmesan cheese. Bake until bread is crisp.
  12. To serve, place the toast on a plate, the patty onto the toast, ladle the onion sauce over the top. Finish with the rest of the parmesan cheese and remaining parsley.

French Onion Salisbury Steak

TitlePart.Title: French Onion Salisbury Steak

BodyPart.Text:
by Tara Newman

  • Prep Time: 5 min
  • Cook Time: 10 min
  • Serves: 4

Recipe

Ingredients

  • 1/4 cup Fresh Parsley
  • 6 cloves Minced Garlic
  • 4 tablespoons Canola Oil
  • 1/2 teaspoon Pepper
  • 1/2 teaspoon Salt
  • 1 teaspoon Dried Thyme
  • 2 teaspoons Dried Oregano
  • 1 Large Egg
  • 3/4 cup Breadcrumbs
  • 1/3 cup Parmesan
  • 2/3 cup Oats
  • 1/2 cup Finely Chopped Onion
  • 3 cups Chopped Mushrooms

Directions

  1. Heat 2-tablespoon oil in large saucepan.
  2. Sauté the mushrooms, onions and garlic over low heat for 3 minutes, or until soft.
  3. In large bowl, add mushroom mixture, oats, parmesan, breadcrumbs, egg, parsley, oregano, salt and pepper, mix well.
  4. Shape mixture into patties.
  5. Heat 2 oil in large skillet over medium heat.
  6. Sauté patties, cooking about 4 minutes on each side – or until golden brown.

TitlePart.Title: Mushroom Burgers

BodyPart.Text:
by Tara Newman

  • Prep Time: 15 min
  • Cook Time: 10 min
  • Serves: 8

Recipe

Ingredients

  • 2 lbs. salmon filets, skinned and finely chopped
  • 3⁄4 cup panko
  • 3⁄4 cup yellow bell pepper, diced
  • 3⁄4 cup red bell pepper, diced
  • 1⁄4 cup bread crumbs
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1⁄2 teaspoon salt & pepper
  • 1⁄4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
  • 1 zest of lemon
  • 1 tablespoon soy sauce
  • 1 large egg

Directions

  1. In a medium bowl, combine peppers, panko, breadcrumbs, garlic and salmon.
  2. In a small bowl, combine egg, soy sauce, lemon zest, parsley, salt & pepper.
  3. Add to pepper mixture tossing gently to combine.
  4. Form mixture into 8 patties.
  5. Lightly coat a grill or skillet with cooking spray.
  6. Using medium-high heat, add the patties and cook approximately 5 minutes per side.

TitlePart.Title: Salmon Burger with Lemon and Herbs

BodyPart.Text:
by Tara Newman

  • Prep Time: 30 min
  • Cook Time: 30 min
  • Serves: 4

Recipe

Ingredients for Sauce

  • 5 Large Pablano Peppers
  • 1 Medium Jalapeño Pepper, Seeded
  • 4 Medium Tomatoes, Quartered
  • 1/2 Sweet Onion, Quartered
  • 3 Garlic Cloves
  • 1 ½ teaspoons Ground Cumin
  • 1/2 teaspoon Paprika
  • 1 teaspoon Salt
  • 1 teaspoon Pepper
  • 1 tablespoon Canola Oil

Ingredients for Filling

  • 1 tablespoon Canola Oil
  • 1/2 Sweet Onion, Diced
  • 4 Garlic Cloves, Minced
  • 1/4 cup Fresh Cilantro
  • 1 ½ cups Shredded Chicken
  • 1 cup White Navy Beans or Northern Beans
  • 3/4 cup chicken broth
  • 1/2 teaspoon Ground Cumin
  • 1/2 teaspoon Garlic Powder
  • 1/4 teaspoon Coriander
  • 1/4 teaspoon Salt
  • ¼ teaspoon Pepper
  • 1 ½ cups Shredded Monterey Jack Cheese
  • Optional Fresh Cilantro, Chopped

Directions for Peppers and Sauce

  1. Pre-heat over to 350 degrees.
  2. Using a small knife, cut a slit lengthwise down one side of each poblano pepper.
  3. Make a small crosswise slit along the top to create a T-shape, try not to cut off the top.
  4. Scoop out the seeds, core and ribs using your thumb or a small spoon.
  5. Using tongs, roast each poblano pepper over an open flame, such as a grill or gas stovetop. (Pepper’s can also be tossed through a tablespoon of oil, place onto a baking sheet, cut side down and roasted in the oven at 450 degrees until blackened.)
  6. Roast until the skin is completely blistered and blackened. Transfer to a glass bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let steam for 10-15 min.
  7. Meanwhile, using a food processor, add the jalapeño, tomatoes, onion, garlic, cumin, paprika, salt & pepper, along with 1/4 cup of water. Bend until smooth.
  8. In a large nonstick skillet, over medium heat, add the canola oil.
  9. Add the tomato mixture to the skillet and simmer, until slightly thick.
  10. Pour the tomato mixture into the bottom of a 9x13-baking dish.
  11. Return skillet back over the heat and follow the directions for the filling below.

Directions for Filling

  1. Add another tablespoon of oil to the skillet; add the onion, garlic and cilantro, sauté 1 minute.
  2. Add the chicken, beans, broth, cumin, garlic powder, coriander, salt & pepper.
  3. Use a table knife, scrape off the charred skins of the poblano peppers.
  4. Carefully stuff each pepper with the filling.
  5. Place each pepper in the casserole dish and top with the shredded cheese.
  6. Cover with foil and bake for 20-30 minutes.
  7. Garnish with cilantro.

Roasted Poblanos with Chicken

TitlePart.Title: Roasted Poblanos Rellenos

BodyPart.Text:
by Tara Newman


Description

Perfectly layered with a combination of roasted butternut squash, shallots, garlic, and sage. Low-fat ricotta, Gruyere cheese, and baby spinach make this lasagna a beautiful fall comfort food.

  • Prep Time: 20 min
  • Cook Time: 25 min
  • Serves: 6

Recipe

Ingredients

  • 1 medium sized butternut squash, cooked
  • 2 tablespoons canola oil
  • 1 teaspoon fresh garlic, minced
  • 1 tablespoon shallot, chopped
  • ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
  • 2 tablespoons fresh sage, chopped
  • 2 eggs, divided
  • 2 cups mozzarella cheese, sliced or shredded, divided
  • 2 cups Gruyere cheese, shredded, divided
  • 1 (30 ounce) container Ricotta cheese
  • ½ cup milk
  • 3 cups baby spinach, roughly chopped
  • 9 lasagna noodles, boiled
  • Salt & pepper

Directions for Squash

  1. To cook the squash, Pre-heat oven to 450 degrees.
  2. Using a vegetable peeler, peel the skin off the squash.
  3. Cut top and bottom off and discard.
  4. Cut squash in half and place face down on a baking sheet that has been sprayed with cooking spray or oil.
  5. Cover with foil and bake 35-45 min. or until squash is tender.
  6. Remove to cool.

Directions for Sauce

  1. Leave oven pre-heated to 450 degrees.
  2. Heat a small saucepan over medium heat, add garlic and shallot, sauté for 2 minutes.
  3. In a large bowl, combine squash, garlic and shallot mixture, nutmeg, sage and the egg white of one egg.
  4. Add a little salt and pepper, mix well and set aside.

Directions for Lasagna

  1. In another medium bowl, combine 1-cup mozzarella, ricotta, milk and remaining egg.
  2. Spray a 9x13 baking dish with cooking spray.
  3. Spread a ⅓ cup of cheese mixture in the bottom of the dish.
  4. Arrange 3 noodles over cheese mixture.
  5. Top with half of squash mixture.
  6. Top with 1½ cups of spinach.
  7. Spread another ⅓ cup of cheese mixture over the spinach.
  8. Cover with 3 noodles again, then the remaining squash mixture.
  9. Spinach again, ending with the cheese mixture on top.
  10. Sprinkle remaining Mozzarella cheese on top.
  11. Cover with foil and bake for 20 minutes.
  12. Remove foil and bake another 10 minutes.
  13. Let stand for 5 minutes to cut perfect squares.

TitlePart.Title: Butternut Squash, Gruyere and Baby Spinach Lasagna

BodyPart.Text:
by Tara Newman


Description

An easy 3 ingredient crostata with a flaky buttery crust, filled with apples, cinnamon, and nutmeg. It's a beautifully rustic pie that's easy and fast.

  • Prep Time: 15 min
  • Cook Time: 30 min
  • Serves: 6

Recipe

Ingredients for Pastry

  • 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • ¼ cup granulated sugar
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • ½ pound (2 sticks) cold unsalted butter, diced
  • 6 tablespoons ice water

Ingredients for Filling

  • 5 tablespoons butter, unsalted
  • 5 pounds apples (peeled and thinly sliced)
  • ½ tablespoons ground cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla

Directions for Pastry

  1. Pre-heat oven to 450 degrees.
  2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
  3. Place the flour, sugar, and salt into the bowl of a food processor, fitted with a steel blade.
  4. Pulse a few times to combine.
  5. Add the butter and pulse 12-15 times, or until the butter is the size of peas.
  6. Add the ice water all at once. Keep pulsing to combine, about another 12 times.
  7. Turn the dough out onto a well-floured board, roll it into a ball, and cut in half forming into 2 disks.
  8. Roll each pastry into an 11-inch circle on a lightly floured surface and transfer to the baking sheet.

Directions for Filling

  1. In a large skillet, over medium heat, add the butter and apples. Sauté 5 minutes.
  2. Sprinkle the brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt over the apples. Stir in vanilla.
  3. Mix well and sauté until the apples have cooked down (about 7 minutes).
  4. Pour mixture into the middle of the pastry crusts, dividing evenly.
  5. Gently fold a 2” border of the pastry, inward, over the fruit.
  6. Pleat the folds to make a seal.
  7. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool for 5 minutes.
  8. Using 2 large spatulas, transfer to a cutting board.
  9. Using a pizza roller, cut into triangles.
  10. Serve warm or at room temperature.

TitlePart.Title: Apple Fruit Crostata

BodyPart.Text:
by Tara Newman


Description

Welcome to Spring. With asparagus season right around the corner, this purely vegetable loaded soup, is sure to put a spring in your step. Don't be fooled with this light broth, sautéing the vegetables makes this full and hearty!

  • Prep Time: 10 min
  • Cook Time: 25 min
  • Serves: 6

Recipe

Ingredients

  • 3 tablespoons canola oil
  • 1 pound carrots, shredded
  • 1 small sweet onion, diced
  • 1 small leek, white part only, chopped
  • ½ tablespoon dried thyme
  • ½ teaspoon fennel seeds
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1 teaspoon pepper
  • 2 garlic cloves minced
  • 1 ½ pounds fresh asparagus
  • 5 cups vegetable broth
  • 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped

Directions

  1. In a large stock pot, over medium heat, add the canola oil, carrots, and onion.
  2. Sauté 3 minutes, add the leek, thyme, fennel, salt, & pepper, sauté another 5 minutes to bring out the sweetness in the vegetables.
  3. Add asparagus to cook 2 minutes.
  4. Add the garlic, cook 1 min.
  5. Add broth and bring to a boil.
  6. Stir in spinach, reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
  7. Garnish with fresh chives or parsley before serving.

Asparagus Soup

TitlePart.Title: Asparagus Soup

BodyPart.Text:
by Tara Newman


Description

As the weather cools down, the farm stands fill up with wonderful vegetables! This loaded corn chowder provides a great way to use your vegetables and freezes well too.

  • Prep Time: 10 min
  • Cook Time: 25 min
  • Serves: 6

Recipe

Ingredients

  • 1/4 Cup Canola Oil
  • 4 Slices Bacon (Chopped)
  • 3 Cups Chicken Broth
  • 4 Cups Corn (cut from 4 ears of corn)
  • 1 Pepper (red or green)
  • 1 Onion (medium sized, chopped)
  • 1 Jalapeño Pepper (seeded and chopped)
  • 1/2 Teaspoon Crushed Red Pepper Flakes
  • 1 Teaspoon Dried Thyme
  • 1/2 Teaspoon Cumen
  • 1/2 Teaspoon Salt
  • 1/2 Teaspoon Pepper
  • 2 Cans 14.74 oz. Creamed Corn
  • 2 Boneless Chicken Breasts Medium (6 oz), cooked, and shredded
  • 3/4 Cup Half and Half
  • 1/4 Cup Chives (chopped)

Directions

  1. In a large pot, over medium heat, add the canola oil and bacon, cook until crisp.
  2. Using a slotted spoon, transfer bacon to paper towel and set aside. Leave bacon drippings.
  3. Add corn kernels, red pepper, onion, jalapeño, red pepper flakes, thyme, thyme, cumin, salt, and pepper.
  4. Sauté vegetables together until soft and golden brown.
  5. Add creamed corn and broth, bring to a boil.
  6. Stir in half and half, the shredded chicken and bacon.
  7. Cook another 10 minutes.
  8. Season with salt and pepper; add the copped chives and serve!

Farmer's Corn Chowder
